credential_access_techniques.name: OS Credential Dumping
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may dump credentials to obtain account login and credential material, usually in the form of a hash or a clear text password, from the operating system and software.

credential_access_techniques.name: Input Capture
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may use methods of capturing user input for obtaining credentials for Valid Accounts and information collection.

credential_access_techniques.name: Brute Force
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to attempt access to accounts when passwords are unknown or when password hashes are obtained.

credential_access_techniques.name: Forced Authentication
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may use forced authentication to gain access to systems. This technique can be used to harvest credentials and gain unauthorized access to systems.

credential_access_techniques.name: Exploitation for Credential Access
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities in an effort to collect credentials.

credential_access_techniques.name: Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may steal or forge Kerberos tickets to assume the identity of a user and authenticate to services within an Active Directory domain.

credential_access_techniques.name: Credentials from Password Stores
credential_access_techniques.description: Adversaries may acquire credentials from password stores that are used to store user credentials for different applications and websites.

credential_access_techniques.name: Steal or Forge Kerberos Tickets: Golden Ticket
credential_access_techniques.description: After gaining domain admin rights, adversaries may create a Golden Ticket, which is a TGT using the KRBTGT account NTLM hash to encrypt and sign.
